text: Eustace Mullins (1923-2010) was a right-wing political activist. He wrote many biographies and history books. The best known is Secrets of the Federal Reserve. He also wrote books opposing the one world government movement. David Randall calls him "one of the world's leading conspiracy theorists".David Randall (January 22, 2006). "Plot or Clot?". The Independent on Sunday. p. 64. He was born in Roanoke, Virginia. He died of a stroke in Hockley, Texas. == References == Category:1923 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American political activists Category:Deaths from stroke Category:People from Virginia
title: Eustace Mullins
